website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few faults, the Lumia 625’s smooth, higher-end design and solid performance make it a great value for the price.
pros: The Nokia Lumia 625's 4.7-inch screen makes for effortless viewing, and the $300 price tag its wallet-friendly for an unlocked phone
Depending on your area, it also supports LTE
cons: For a phone of its size, the Lumia 625's too-low resolution is fuzzy and dull compared to premium Lumias
The 625's 5-megapixel camera struggles taking photos in the shade

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Like this phone. Bought an unlocked phone and it works great. Nokia is my all time favorite phone and love that it works with windows.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Jonsdottir

customer_reviews.title: Don't work like it says it does in the description
customer_reviews.text: Don't look nothing like it shows on the picture and you can't put you email on it for some odd reason.
customer_reviews.author: Antyon Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!  Fast and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. The user interface is fast and easy. Popped in an LTE microSIM and was off to the races. Love the speed on the "Internet Sharing" (hotspot/access point) for connecting my notebook and other devices. Also, love the downloadable maps which can be used offline. MS Office is a big bonus. My main complaint was that the import of my Contacts had to be done via Bluetooth from my old phone rather than a VCF file.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: 85 but the phone is awesome and super cool
customer_reviews.text: This should be 4.85 but the phone is awesome and super cool, super slim. It's hard to find a substitute for this phone :( The phone is a great phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jerwayne Henry

customer_reviews.title: beauty case
customer_reviews.text: Good product, excellent presentation. Its fits exactly in the housing and that is an additional special protective plastic screen smartphone
customer_reviews.author: hugo diaz lavigne

customer_reviews.title: Invoice
customer_reviews.text: I need to see the IMEI or serial number of the item i have bought on the invoice or receipt
customer_reviews.author: mercy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the charger was not usable the adapter does not fit standard wall plug
customer_reviews.author: wesley moss

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I live in Trinidad and Tobago and I purchased this phone for use in my own country and it worked very well. i just had to changed the language and put in a sim and it was ready for use as it was unlocked as advertised. This phone is just right for my needs. It is a mid range phone but a very good one. navigating windows is easy and the phone experienced no freezing etc; an overall good experience so far. the camera is good.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazingShopper

customer_reviews.title: This phone is a really great device
customer_reviews.text: This phone is a really great device. The design feels good in your hands and is a good weight. I like the proportions around the screen and is a beautiful simple design. I am looking forward to the Windows Phone 8.1 update.
customer_reviews.author: JULIE BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: Above my expectations...especially after downloading windows 8.1. Will stay loyal to Microsoft. Think I might upgrade to the Lumia 1520 for more power and features. If this cheaper model is so impressive far less for the higher end versions.
customer_reviews.author: Earlepo

product_meta.title: Nokia - Lumia 625 Windows Phone, 8GB, Unlocked GSM Phone - Black
feature_bullets: Unlocked cell phones are compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile as well as with GSM SIM cards (e.g. H20, Straight Talk, and select prepaid carriers). Unlocked cell phones will not work with CDMA Carriers like Sprint, Verizon, Boost or Virgin.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars24 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
